learning_outcomes.description: Gain in-depth knowledge of the core principles in the information retrieval field such as  text representation and similarity computation, indexing textual documents, query correction and expansion, retrieval models, performance evaluation and metrics
Acquire hands-on practical experience with the development of components of Web search engines and experimentation of end-to-end systems using relevant open-source libraries.
Understand advanced topics in information retrieval research such as learning to rank, neural retrieval and ranking.
Create, analyse and evaluate novel information retrieval solutions to search related problems
Compare and contrast information retrieval methods and communicate their differences, advantages and disadvantages, based on quantitative evaluation.
Analyse search tasks and problems, and identify and communicate relevant information retrieval solutions.

assessments.task_description: Online Quizzes on Blackboard. To be completed individually.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: 100% Late Penalty after 1 hour grace period. The one-hour grace period is recorded from the time the submission is due.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This project requires students to implement a set of identified indexing and retrieval methods. The students also need to evaluate and analyse the results of the techniques.

This is an individually assessed project.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Practicals

Practicals will provide an opportunity to further understand the concepts and techniques introduced in the lectures via examples, exercises, projects and problem-solving. Further concepts will be developed during these activities. There will be a mix of theory and hands-on activities. NOTE: these sessions start from week 1 and run until week 13 included.


Learning outcomes: L02, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Practicals Practicals will provide an opportunity to further understand the concepts and techniques introduced in the lectures via examples, exercises, projects and problem-solving. Further concepts will be developed during these activities. There will be a mix of theory and hands-on activities. NOTE: these sessions start from week 1 and run until week 13 included.

learning_activities.topic:
Intro, Search Engine Architecture, Text Analysis

Introduction, Motivation and Logistic. Architecture of a Search Engine, key components of study across this course. Zipf's Law, Stemming, Stopwording. Indexing techniques and processing, including data structures.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Intro, Search Engine Architecture, Text Analysis Introduction, Motivation and Logistic. Architecture of a Search Engine, key components of study across this course. Zipf's Law, Stemming, Stopwording. Indexing techniques and processing, including data structures.

learning_activities.topic:
Offline Evaluation

Offline evaluation methodology and evaluation frameworks, set-based and rank-based evaluation measures, statistical significance testing, parameter tuning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Offline Evaluation Offline evaluation methodology and evaluation frameworks, set-based and rank-based evaluation measures, statistical significance testing, parameter tuning.

learning_activities.topic:
Retrieval Models 1

Retrieval Models: term-based and term dependency methods for matching and ranking documents.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Retrieval Models 1 Retrieval Models: term-based and term dependency methods for matching and ranking documents.

learning_activities.topic:
Retrieval Models 2

Fusion methods and semantic matching methods

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Retrieval Models 2 Fusion methods and semantic matching methods

learning_activities.topic:
Retrieval Models 3

Methods based on query analysis, query expansion, word embeddings, relevance feedback

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Retrieval Models 3 Methods based on query analysis, query expansion, word embeddings, relevance feedback

learning_activities.topic:
Retrieval Models 4

Learning to rank

Learning outcomes: L03, L05

Retrieval Models 5

Exploit Implicit Signals: Online Learning to rank, federated online learning to rank, counterfactual learning, online evaluation, click models

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Retrieval Models 5 Exploit Implicit Signals: Online Learning to rank, federated online learning to rank, counterfactual learning, online evaluation, click models

Pre-trained language models, Transformers and the BERT rankers

Learning outcomes: L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Retrieval Models 6 Pre-trained language models, Transformers and the BERT rankers

learning_activities.topic:
Index Compression

Entropy and ambiguity, methods for compression: delta encoding, bit aligned codes, byte aligned codes; looking ahead and skipping

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Index Compression Entropy and ambiguity, methods for compression: delta encoding, bit aligned codes, byte aligned codes; looking ahead and skipping

learning_activities.topic:
Crawling and Link Analysis

Methods for crawling Web pages; making use of link information for retrieval: PageRank and HITS.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Crawling and Link Analysis Methods for crawling Web pages; making use of link information for retrieval: PageRank and HITS.

learning_activities.topic:
Interactive IR, Diversity

Evaluation practices based on experiments with users. Ranking methods for diversity, ambiguity and redundancy

Learning outcomes: L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Interactive IR, Diversity Evaluation practices based on experiments with users. Ranking methods for diversity, ambiguity and redundancy
